website_summaries.verdict: While it's not fit for writing your next term paper on, the Asus ZenPad Z8 is our favorite budget Android tablet and is perfect for casual use.
pros: The Asus Zen Pad Z8 starts at only $149 with 4G LTE
It's slim and lightweight with a sharp, bright screen and smooth performance
The battery lasts longer than the vast majority of tablets and charges quickly via USB-C
cons: The front-facing speaker and camera quality leave a lot to be desired

customer_reviews.title: Has mtklogger on it.(AKA COMPANY SPYWARE) Can use all your free space in a single day. F'ing BS!
customer_reviews.text: It would get 5 stars if it didn't have have mtklogger (AKA COMPANY SPYWARE) on it. mtklogger constantly logs every single thing on your tablet, and fills up your memory, basically impossible to uninstall without rooting your tablet. You have to delete the mtklogger directory folder every 1-4 days to free up space. When I play my games online, or offline I have to delete the directory folder multiple times a day. This is my 8th tablet, and the only one that I have had this problem with.
customer_reviews.author: ANTHONY

customer_reviews.title: Awesome little table that actually lives up to the hype!
customer_reviews.text: Nice little tablet for around the house. I work in IT and have used MANY, SO MANY tablets that have not lived up to the hype. I needed a smaller tablet for a very long international trip and the tablet battery lasted the entire way. I did a lot of research and this was by far the most bang for the buck. Great picture and great sound.
customer_reviews.author: IT Pro

customer_reviews.title: Won't Allow SD Card to be Mounted as Internal Storage
customer_reviews.text: They disable the ability to mount the SD card as internal storage which is typically available in this version of Android. Install 1 app and use Gmail and you run out. This thing sucks. I am not sure why Asus won't let you mount an SD card as internal storage but it simply doesn't work. This thing is so filled with Asus bloatware apps that the 16 gigs is gone upon purchase. Total bummer.
customer_reviews.author: fear of chuck

customer_reviews.title: Best bang for the buck
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a replacement for my beloved Nexus 7. The 7 inch pad market is essentially dead, but the 8 inch tablets are not much bigger so I concentrated on those models. I was leaning towards getting a dirt cheap Samsung Tab but that model came with the now outdated Android 4 OS and it wasn't upgradeable. I was then leaning toward a Lenovo but discovered that the screen was NOT gorilla glass. Bought this one and am completely satisfied. Outstanding sound, great screen, expandable memory, and quick as lightning. Feels good in my hand and the complaints about "bloatware" are a bit overblown. And the battery is simply amazing.
customer_reviews.author: Sargeast

customer_reviews.title: Really nice tablet.
customer_reviews.text: This is a really nice tablet, end of story. No problems whatsoever. The updates took a little long but I'm installing my apps easily & super fast. A lot of customization with the UI as well. Nice screen & feel. If you're on the fence about a 8" or 10", go with this. Not only is way cheaper ($130 for me) but I don't feel cheated with the screen size at all, plus it's easier to hold. Battery has lasted a few days with moderate use. Very satisfied with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Sedith

customer_reviews.title: It’s a nice tablet that gets the job done
customer_reviews.text: It’s a nice tablet that gets the job done. It runs most of my apps just fine and it has an upgrade to Android 7 which is nice. The negatives listed below are very minor and don’t take away from the usage in my opinion. I’m listing them for the sake of being informative. I had to go through several updates before using it. It comes with some unnecessary software that can be hidden or removed. The processor is a bit slow for some things but you probably won’t notice unless you’re trying the most demanding 3D games.
customer_reviews.author: Amos A

customer_reviews.title: My old Nexus 7 could be taken 100 feet from the wifi signal and still picked up a good strong signal at the same facility
customer_reviews.text: Tablet is okay for my limited purposes. just to carry around, pass the time with games, check email. The big complaint I have is that I use this with Pandora to play music for my water aerobics class. The wifi has a very short range, if I place the tablet farther than 25-30 feet from the wifi source at the fitness center it looses the signal. My old Nexus 7 could be taken 100 feet from the wifi signal and still picked up a good strong signal at the same facility.
customer_reviews.author: HoneyBeeLane

customer_reviews.title: Great tablet / Great Price
customer_reviews.text: My 12 year old saved his money and bought this himself. He loves this tablet so much. He is able to use it for Khan Academy, Netflix, Hulu, Minecraft and just about any other Android app that you can think of. It has a pretty decent battery life and good resolution. The screen can get bright enough to use outside in the sun.
customer_reviews.author: Mark and Nikki

customer_reviews.title: SD card can't be used for apps
customer_reviews.text: Really not the quality I've learned to expect from ASUS over the years. 2 stars because the price is good and it does more or less what I want it to. However, it's not possible to move apps to an SD card, and there is very little available space for games, which is what I bought this for. I'm going to have to find a workaround, and I shouldn't have to. There is really no excuse for advertising expandable storage and then not letting people use it for apps. Ridiculous. Also, the games I run should do fine on 2gb ram, yet they run in low end mode. I guess you get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: QS

customer_reviews.title: Best Tablet Best Price
customer_reviews.text: This tablet is great. I bought this zenpad 8 for my wife to replace an overpriced galaxy note 10 that died after only 2 or 3 years of use. The ASUS Z380M-A2-GR Zenpad 8 is less than a third the price of that old samsung and does most everything better. I was so impressed with my wife's zenpad that I bought another for myself about a month later and the price had even dropped . I will recommend ASUS tablets to everyone I know. ASUS has been a trusted name in my household for years when buying computer equipment, so it really should not surprise me that they make excellent tablets at awesome prices as well. Way to go ASUS!
customer_reviews.author: fishsticks

customer_reviews.title: Cheap Product, Horrible Service and Warranty
customer_reviews.text: The device worked reasonably for the first few months, but then began to experience display issues. Used warranty for repair and upon return, the device would still not operate as expected. Sent back again and this time, the company used tiny scratches on the case and screen (normal wear and tear, and mind you, on the device upon initial repair) to deny the warranty repair. Do yourself a favor, DO NOT buy anything from ASUS!!!
customer_reviews.author: Couch Potato

customer_reviews.title: Decent tablet but crappy battery life for pretty minimal use
customer_reviews.text: The screen is great, the tablet is fine for my needs, which don't include playing any games and not watching a lot of videos are listening to much music. I mostly use the tablet as a reader and occasionally to browse online. For this reason, I find the poor battery life a real negative. Have two other 7" tablets, a Samsung and a Lenovo, and both of them have noticeably better battery life, especially the Samsung. All three have the same apps loaded and similar use patterns, so it's pretty easy to see the disparity between the tablets. I can't say how often I've had to charge overnight because I'm caught unaware how quickly the battery drains. :(
customer_reviews.author: Adriano's Mom

customer_reviews.title: Nice.
customer_reviews.text: I can't speak for other reviewers, but my pad works faster than my laptop running W10. Picture is crisp and clear. No problems with charging and the battery is long-lasting compared to my laptop and other pads I've owned. It needs a little customization with settings to personalize it to your usage preferences, but that wont take very long, even if you are tech-challenged. Don't expect to play Skyrim on this pad, and you'll get a lot of bang for your buck.
customer_reviews.author: Caroline M.Top Contributor: Doctor Who

customer_reviews.title: Love this Tablet.
customer_reviews.text: Love this tablet. I had the ASUS 2013 tablet till the charging port stopped working. This tablet is perfect for what I need. Big enough size to play games, read books and browse the internet. Will enjoy looking into the other features and programs that it has. I has been upgraded to Android 7.0
customer_reviews.author: Frank Spikes

customer_reviews.title: Too much bloatware causes space issues....
customer_reviews.text: The biggest pro to this tablet is the speed - the biggest con is that there's so much bloatware I ran out of space within a week! The bloatware cannot be removed, so I was only able to keep 3-4 apps on the tablet (no Netflix, no Facebook). At least a third of the built in space is taken up by system files and bloatware. Thankfully, another reviewers post showed me how to expand the internal drive so I seem to be up and running now with 48GB of space. If it weren't for that post I would have returned the tablet. Those instructions can be found at
customer_reviews.author: Kevin B.

customer_reviews.title: Great Tablet - Update: Not so great now.
customer_reviews.text: This is an awesome tablet. After reading the reviews I wondered if I would have any of the problems others have had and thankfully no issues at all. This tablet is fast and with 2gb memory I can do everything with no problems. Battery last a full day with heavy use. I got the 16 gb model and with 88 apps I have used 50% of the storage. If your looking for a good tablet get this one you won't be disappointed. Update: This tablet is now very slow. I reset the tablet but no luck it's just so sorry it's unusable. Why can't companies make these years as fast s phones, it just makes no sense.
customer_reviews.author: michaelwy

customer_reviews.title: Extremely Useful for Photography
customer_reviews.text: I bought this tablet SOLELY for controlling my Canon T4i DSLR using DSLR Controller while doing macrophotography. The item was on time and as advertised. Macrophotography, is infinitely easier using this tablet and DSLR Controller. While I have no other use for a tablet controller, its ability to control my DSLR makes it well worth the price. I would buy from this vendor again.
customer_reviews.author: DeanimatorTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Very nice tablet
customer_reviews.text: I've read some earlier reviews that stated this tablet came with a lot of bloatware - must have been for a different model. I'm a long time user of Asus products. They have made their fair share of mistakes but this tablet certainly is not one of them. Updated to Android version 7.1 and everything works as it should. Well worth the price but if you ever need tech support - ask your granny first because the tech support from Asus has to be the world's worst. They get paid by the email from what I've read and they will keep you going swapping emails and asking 20 questions until your fingers fall off trying to provide you assistance.
customer_reviews.author: Bob S

customer_reviews.title: Arrived broken
customer_reviews.text: I couldn't get it to charge, but a little sleuthing showed that it shipped with a broken charging cord. Then, after using it for one day, everytime I set it down or tap the back the unit shuts itself off completely.
customer_reviews.author: lney308

customer_reviews.title: the ZenPad 8 was fantastic. It even connected to Android Studio without a ...
customer_reviews.text: At first, the ZenPad 8 was fantastic. It even connected to Android Studio without a hitch. I never used it much, as I have several devices. It sat in it's case most of the time. But now, it will only hold a charge for half a day at most. I removed every app and set the device to battery saving mode - no change. I am very disappointed in Asus, as after perusing the internet, I find that I am not the only with the problem. My smartwatch is an Asus, which I love and use all the time without a hiccup.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Brown

customer_reviews.title: Barely lasted a year, terrible battery life
customer_reviews.text: This WAS a great tablet. After just a year of use, it's dead. No amount of charging or anything else works. Before it died, I thought it was great BUT!! it had terrible battery life. not a deal breaker for me, and the way I used it... but it might have been for someone else. Anyway, the thing died. It gets a bad review now.
customer_reviews.author: Askingboy

customer_reviews.title: Storage not upgradable.
customer_reviews.text: I am so tired of these nanny-state manufactures disabling built-in OS functions for some undocumented reasons. This tablet comes with 16GB of internal storage and a MicroSD slot that is all but useless because ASUS disabled the built in OS function that would allow the use of MicroSD as internal storage. To be fair to ASUS, almost all of the manufactures do this now and there is really no good reason why except that they want everyone to buy new devices when their current, perfectly good device, tells them it's "out of memory". If you want to really own your hardware, root this damn thing, or don't buy from ASUS.... period.
customer_reviews.author: Michael R Boyd

customer_reviews.title: Slow to boot up from total off position.
customer_reviews.text: I've had it about 10 days, seems to work well for a tablet. It is very slow to boot up, taking about 1.5 minutes. Much slower that the Amazon fire, but it also has far greater flexibility. Boot up from sleep fast, but if you leave it in sleep mode for a day, it will lose about 10% of charge. Curiously, installing the SD card requires one to remove the back of the tablet; never seen that in a tablet before.
customer_reviews.author: GoodTimeCharlie

customer_reviews.title: Great affordable tablet
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a replacement for an older tablet and it works GREAT. This device has been in use every day mounted to the dash of my vehicle with a ram mount. I always have google maps up on it with pandora playing in the back ground. This tablet has never given me any hickup. I was worried about it recently when the overnight temps were near -30 however it turned on in the morning like a champ. You never would have known that it was so cold my finger almost froze to the tablet.
customer_reviews.author: JustAnotherAmazonCustomer

customer_reviews.title: Badly positioned power switch, drops wireless connections often
customer_reviews.text: Tablet performance is frustrating and erratic. Bluetooth connections are erratic, for some reason Bluetooth will turn itself off while headphones are connected. This behaviors persists across several different headphone brands. I use Plex, and when viewing videos the wireless connection will drop for no reason. sometimes I can retry and it will work, more often I will have to stop the app and restart it. No other tablet or phone shows this behavior. Update: I forgot to mention how inconvenient the power switch is located. It's almost impossible to pick up the tablet without touching the switch and causing an unintended response from the tablet. It's hard to imagine a worse location for it.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Guzik

customer_reviews.title: Not so great after 6 months of use
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my daughter almost a year ago. It worked great for about 6 months. She took very good care of it and had it in a case almost all the time. Started slowing down, battery draining quickly and sometimes would not turn on. After a few months of that it just quit working all together. I was very disappointed, as she had my hand me down Samsung tablet that lasted a total of 5 years between the two of us. We have had another Asus tablet in the past that lasted 2 years so I was not happy this never even made it to one year.
customer_reviews.author: ANTLE5

customer_reviews.title: Very capable tablet for the price. No major complaints.
customer_reviews.text: I continue to be impressed with this tablet! I cant believe how capable it is for this price range. One minor issue is the screen auto adjust feature dims it too much. Easy enough to turn this feature off though. Would definately buy this again.
customer_reviews.author: MichiganReview

customer_reviews.title: Hard to go wrong with this one.
customer_reviews.text: I was doubtful about this tablet at first but purchased two of these anyway as replacements for two old tablets. Excellent products! Fast, easy to use and has a great selection of apps. Larger display takes a little getting used to but will spoil you. Some bloatware but not a lot compared to most. 16GB internal storage but 4+ GB of that is system reserved, which is the only thing keeping me from giving 5 stars. Has SD micro slot though for up to 128GB more which helps immensely. Good bargain for the price and we are quite happy with them.
customer_reviews.author: inveterate reader

customer_reviews.title: Good quality for a decent price.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this tablet mainly for work. The touch screen is responsive and the screen resolution is nice. Unless you're going to be running a lot of intensive applications, this is a great tablet for the average user. I've had many Asus products in the past and have always been happy with my purchases.
customer_reviews.author: c.holtz

customer_reviews.title: Good, reasonably fast tablet, with good battery life
customer_reviews.text: While this tablet is not a speed demon, the 2 GB of RAM eliminates the "lag" I experienced with a previous generation ASUS tablet. There are some apps that are per-installed, which cannot be removed. However they can be disabled. I am using a 128 gb microsd card and it works great. I would have preferred stock Android, but ASUS's version of Android is ok, it doesn't get in my way. I was surprised to learn that this device supports both the 2.4 and 5 GHz wifi bands.
customer_reviews.author: ET

customer_reviews.title: My husband loves reading EBooks on this. He's gone ...
customer_reviews.text: My husband loves reading EBooks on this. He's gone kicking and screaming into the 21st century with all of it's gadgets but he really likes this ZenPad. Planning on buying another one.
customer_reviews.author: catlady

customer_reviews.title: Nice tablet
customer_reviews.text: Very nice tablet for the price. Actually this is my 2nd one since I have replace older tablets that wouldn't run/upgrade to Android 6.0 (and now 7.0) If you need an Android tablet but don't want to spend $300+ or have a heat attack if you drop/loose it (or brick it if you are a developer) this is a very nice choice. Usually I have had to deal with blurry screens and "sluggish" performance with other <$500 tablet, but not with the ZenPad8.
customer_reviews.author: Socrates1

customer_reviews.title: The screen is good and performance very good
customer_reviews.text: A solid tablet for the money. The screen is good and performance very good. The only downside is it's a bit heavier than some, but that's to be expected at this price point and I knew that before I purchased it. You have to pick where you're willing to compromise to save money and for me that was weight. Highly recommended
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great tablet for the money.
customer_reviews.text: I couldn't give it 5 stars because it only charges to 90% of its battery compacity. Other than that great tablet for under $130 amazon warehouse deals.
customer_reviews.author: Jwderos

customer_reviews.title: 2 year review
customer_reviews.text: I have had this tablet for 2 years now and it has worked flawlessly. This is a great tablet. I use it mostly for reading and web surfing, not gaming. However after 2 years the battery is starting to wear down. Im loosing about 20% power every half hour. Ive usually maintained the charge between 40 and 80% as recommended. I will upgrade to the 32k Asus.
customer_reviews.author: Greenman NC

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing lack of quality control
customer_reviews.text: Refused to maintain a wifi connection. Randomy dropped the necessary wifi credentials even after they were successfully saved. I tried clearing all wifi settings and a full factory reset. Seller misrepresented the item's functioning
customer_reviews.author: JT

customer_reviews.title: Great replacement for my Nexus 7 2012
customer_reviews.text: My old Nexus 7 finally gave up the ghost after five years. This is what I chose to replace it. It upgraded itself to Android 6 and then 7 right away. I would definitely recommend this tablet.
customer_reviews.author: Chris B

customer_reviews.title: Great little tablet
customer_reviews.text: I bought it for my DSLR camera so I can use it as a remote trigger, since my Nikon D3200's app can only run on Android. Over all its a decent little tablet, great screen quality, and expandable memory. I don't use it for anything else but being a remote trigger for my camera or if I am doing vlogs, i can mount it on my tripod and use it as a screen for my DSLR. Great little tablet.
customer_reviews.author: Vedran Simic

customer_reviews.title: GPS sensor works great along with downloaded google maps gives turn by turn ...
customer_reviews.text: Works as it should. GPS sensor works great along with downloaded google maps gives turn by turn driving directions.Re-routes as it should when you leave the line of travel. Both 5 ghz and 2.4 ghz wi-fi connection. Could use a 32 gig internal memory instead of 16 so depending on how many apps you install it could be an issue. My hope is that as Marshmallow 6.0 updates you will be able to format the micro sd card as internal memory, we will wait and see. c
customer_reviews.author: Runs_with_fire

customer_reviews.title: mtklog
customer_reviews.text: Works great for the price but it creates a mtklog file that over time will is all of your available space. Mine was 4.5gb when I noticed it. You can delete the file but it just creates another one.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Battery must be defective, or something is shorting or drawing battery down while off overnight
customer_reviews.text: Am trying to return this, it took a charge and kept the charge for about 4 days of light use, charging at night. Last night is was at 68%, not used overnight. This morning battery totally dead, will not start. Need to return and look at Samsung solution. Battery must be defective, or something is shorting or drawing battery down while off. Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: RT

customer_reviews.title: Asus tablet zenpad 8.0
customer_reviews.text: I'm impressed with the quality of this tablet ... I really did not think it exceeded my expectations so much ... it has an incredible performance I am an android games player and the games that I have played in this tablet simply look and move incredibly well ... do not hesitate to buy it you will not regret it
customer_reviews.author: Ariel

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't last long
customer_reviews.text: I purchased 3 of these for my children. After reading several reviews, I thought it would be great for them. They basically watch YouTube Kids videos and play Temple Run. After a mere 6 months, the screen gave out on one. It looks like it wants to do something but the screen just gives out. Watching to see if the others ones give out as well. Considering purchasing another one, just a little hesitant as a 6 month lifespan isn't really good.
customer_reviews.author: OliverG

customer_reviews.title: Incredibe value
customer_reviews.text: This tabet is a fabulous value excellent build quality, responsive screen, dualband wifi, 2GB ram. All little tweaks to make it better than the average for this price. My only 2 complaints are the plastic back cover (deserves better), the power button on the side, making it very hard to pick up without turning on, and the inabiity to use adoptable storage without a quick adb command. Otherwise, pretty perfect.
customer_reviews.author: John V. Kaprielian

customer_reviews.title: operating system upgrades impossible
customer_reviews.text: operating system upgrades impossible, I can not stress enough what a piece of junk this tablet is. ASUS took everyone for a ride on this one and won't even upgrade the operating system to possibly improve the tablet. ASUS ripped a lot of people off with this device and don't care they did. Save your money and buy a different tablet. It will save you a lot of aggravation.
customer_reviews.author: Rene Kedrowitsch

customer_reviews.title: Can't Save Apps to sdCard!
customer_reviews.text: I was really excited about rhis tablet especially for the price. I was very disappointed to find out that while it has a sd card slot you cant save apps to the sd card. So you are very limited on internal space. I got the tablet for trips and light entertainment. After Netflix, Kindle and Tidal I had little internal space left. I reached out to the service center and was told " I am sorry to say but the android edition no longer supports apps to SD." Bummer!
customer_reviews.author: zach brown

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful tablet, great build, speedy.
customer_reviews.text: The ZenPad 8 works great!. Speedy, responsive and looks great. The tablet looks solid and performs very well. No problems. The only thing I would suggest is to be careful when buying screen protectors or cases as we've bought several that did not work right. So look to make sure the the specific model is correct!
customer_reviews.author: Healthy Nut

customer_reviews.title: Great tablet
customer_reviews.text: I actually bought this originally to use as a digital dash in my old Datsun 260Z. Works great for that purpose, but I find myself using it for just about everything. Great display, long battery life, perfect size for use in and out of the car.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Sheen

customer_reviews.title: I doubt you could buy a better android tablet
customer_reviews.text: I doubt you could buy a better android tablet. Very thin and powerful; all apps feel snappy and responsive. Amazon's Workspaces client isn't working with it yet, but they're working on it and a bluetooth mouse syncs with it flawlessly for desktop-like use.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Works Well
customer_reviews.text: Have only had the tablet for a couple of days, but I'm loving it. Easy set up. Things load quickly. Screen quality is good. Clear picture and video. Battery is holding up well to my almost nonstop usage since it arrived. My only complaint is that its 16 gb but it seems that's already halfway eaten up by what's already installed and the operating system, that was a bit disappointing. But over all it seems worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Overall it's ok.
customer_reviews.text: Pros: works very well, good size, readable display, good RAM capacity. Cons: Can NOT be rooted, has bloatware which you can't remove, slow to boot, eats up the battery if left in standby, microusb port is upside down, usb cable is too short, short range wifi, you have to remove the cover to access microsd.
customer_reviews.author: Socketz

customer_reviews.title: Just can't beat this pad
customer_reviews.text: Really nice device for the money. Quick response, feels great in the hand, very nice resolution, great camera, newest version of Android OS. After having this pad three months the charging port has started failing. It is a serious issue but other than that it is a stellar device. I am removing one of the stars until I have it back from repair.
customer_reviews.author: The Raven

customer_reviews.title: Took 2 years, now the battery bloat begins
customer_reviews.text: These cheaper devices always seem to have bad batteries. I've been using this device as a perktv/swagbucks/additional monitor for about 2 years. Then you start noticing the screen start to discolor, then it starts to bulge as the battery bloats and pushes out. I wish designed these things with swap-able batteries, it would prevent the always plugged in devices from this kind of malfunction and people could buy extra batteries to swap in and out.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: It was relatively inexpensive so it is a good place being learning
customer_reviews.text: I getting into it. I use it for a Metronome for piano practice. I can see using it more on the college campus connected to the campus Wi-Fi. That's the future. It was relatively inexpensive so it is a good place being learning.
customer_reviews.author: SG

customer_reviews.title: Not a great tablet.
customer_reviews.text: Very unhappy with the performance of this tablet. Wi-Fi drops constantly, and when it is connected download speeds are under 60 Mbps. I have 200 Mbps and other devices connect to my Wi-Fi at 150 Mbps and above. The constant drops pretty much make the device unusable except maybe as a reader. Multiple factory resets did nothing and support has been nonexistent.
customer_reviews.author: Road Warrior

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality for a good price
customer_reviews.text: Its the second ASUS tablet I've owned. Never any problems with the 7" I purchased 4 years ago but this 8" is a huge step up in quality. Its early days yet, but the screen quality is excellent and the loaded apps seem relevant and much trimmed back from the bloatware bundled with the earlier tablet. It readily updated to Android 7 and updated the ASUS supplied software as well. Prompt delivery - no problems
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great replacement for my Verizon tablet
customer_reviews.text: Great replacement for my Verizon tablet. The only thing I don't like is the low internal storage. I had to delete/uninstall many apps that I don't use frequently to allow room for the storage for the apps I do use. Still trying to figure out how to move some of my data and apps to my external storage device. It is, for the most part, a great tablet at a great price and is quick. Would buy again if I can figure out the storage issue and if not I will upgrade to the tablet with bigger internal storage.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Gruel

customer_reviews.title: For the Price, Cannot Be Topped
customer_reviews.text: It's not the most powerful tablet ever and it would benefit greatly from QuickCharge technology. The ability to add a SIM for 3/4G would be nice, but my phone has hotspot capabilities. On the other hand, it's around $120 and for that price, it's an awesome little tablet. I haven't been able to slow it down yet and the battery could last for a couple of days of light use.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Z.

customer_reviews.title: I really really like this!
customer_reviews.text: This replaced my first generation Google tablet. ASUS easily transferred all my apps to my new ASUS Zenpad. I like having two cameras--forward and rear facing. I like the different organizational ways of viewing the apps--most often used; alphabetical; category, i.e. communication, social, banking; easy mode. I'm still learning this tablet's features.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia S.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome device
customer_reviews.text: Got 2 of these tablets. Decided to go with the Asus as I've had their Zenfone cell phones for the last few years and loved them. Saw the Samsung 8 inch tablet at Costco. This tablet was more updated than the Samsung 8 inch tablet for the same price. Android updated out of the box to version 7.0 I'd say this is very comparable to the Samsung 8 inch tablet, but with more updated software.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Not the best for downloading apps.
customer_reviews.text: The tablet works great, it is fast and last a long time before having to charge it.The only reason I purchased it was to use as the screen for my drone and it works. The only issue is the limited amount of apps that you can install in the internal memory and you cannot use the extended storage to move the apps. Also you cannot delete the ones that comes in the tablet to make more room.
customer_reviews.author: Edgardo Roman

customer_reviews.title: Satisfied
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Asus tablet and I like both of them. The only downside is this one is pre-loaded with a bunch of Asus Zen software I don't need which keeps trying to take over everything, and some of it can't be disabled. I use Nova launcher to get around most of that, but Asus should stick to making hardware, their software is obtrusive and annoying.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: A solid everyday tablet
customer_reviews.text: This is exactly what you would expect for a solid, mid - line tablet. Screen is decent. Fast enough for all day to day use (I'm not a gamer). Battery not up with the most expensive tablets but a great solid choice for everyday use.
customer_reviews.author: dab123

customer_reviews.title: Solid buy.
customer_reviews.text: Inexpensive, yet solid unit. Annoying black screen issue made me return the first unit. The replacement seems more stable, but black-screen-of-android-death occasionally returns (eventually jumping back to login screen). I'd buy again given the features and performance for its low price.
customer_reviews.author: Ben Pluim

customer_reviews.title: NO SIM CARD slot
customer_reviews.text: It works well but I was disappointed that it had no sim card. I should have read the description more closely looking for this feature. I bought it to do social media videos & Square purchases on location, but since it has no sim card slot, I couldn’t hook it to my cell company plan. It can ONLY work with WiFi, which I don’t always have available, so kinda defeated my purpose. Now I know why the price seemed really good. Oh well. I only get to use it occasionally
customer_reviews.author: Lystra Inspires

customer_reviews.title: Looked nice but unfortunately had to return it because ASUS had ...
customer_reviews.text: Looked nice but unfortunately had to return it because ASUS had disabled the ability to put multiple users, which we rely on for customizing for the kids. The parental controls don't give as many options.
customer_reviews.author: LC

customer_reviews.title: My sound dumb but i only bought this for one reason.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this tablet to play one game (Summoners war) and it does that perfectly! I gave picture quality a 1 because it's actually pretty bad but I didn't buy this tablet to take pictures. If you're like me and need a cheap tablet to play a game and maybe check social media without occupying you're phone then get this!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very nice screen, software could use some work
customer_reviews.text: Very nice screen, software could use some work, if wifi turned on it constantly restarts and shuts down. I use it mainly as an ereader, far more control and much faster than dedicated reader. Way too much bloatware, LG tablet is much better, closer to pure android. Asus zenpad 8 works very well. The Bobj rugged case is perfect, some may find it heavy, but protects well and comfortable, well engineered. Asus tech support is a joke, clueless
customer_reviews.author: grinchmike

customer_reviews.title: Screen kept going grey, a few reboots would typically ...
customer_reviews.text: Screen kept going grey, a few reboots would typically fix it. I ended up returning it. Software is extremely bloated. It would greatly benefit from a unlocked boot loader.
customer_reviews.author: Mrhone2

customer_reviews.title: the connectivity is terrible. It is constantly trying to load google junk
customer_reviews.text: If you need a cheap tablet this might work for you. The battery life is virtually non existent. Unless you are sitting on you router, the connectivity is terrible. It is constantly trying to load google junk. It has something called safe mode that shows up at random times locking you out of you apps.
customer_reviews.author: barry gearhart

customer_reviews.title: A cheap Android tablet that's up to date in software
customer_reviews.text: With the exception of Asus UI this is a good bang for your buck tablet. The screen is amazing and the single front firing speaker does a decent job. The color reproduction are decent and Asus UI is customizable.
customer_reviews.author: KARL PERALTA

customer_reviews.title: best bargain tablet on the market
customer_reviews.text: best bargain tablet on the market. Updated to Android 7 via OTA. This is what a Nexus 8 would have been. Minimal bloat, and what there is is removable, but is also very usable.
customer_reviews.author: David M. Harrison

customer_reviews.title: In love
customer_reviews.text: I've only had it about 8 hours, but I'm already in love with it. I use it for my Phantom 3 Standard Drone and it works perfect. Nice clear image and lots larger screen. It sets itself up very easily, especially if you already have another android device. Plus you can use the Google chrome browser. The processor has showed no lag whatsoever so far in videos etc.
customer_reviews.author: Lufkin Fokker

customer_reviews.title: It's great for when your other tablet or phone is charging ...
customer_reviews.text: It is what you pay for. It's great for when your other tablet or phone is charging everything is really good but the front facing camera sucks for video or pictures but the rear one is pretty good for taking photos. I do like it's size and use it when I want to take it with me to the grocery store or when we go to the casino and am waiting forever for my husband to finally leave! Remember it works where there is WiFi Internet access and does not work without ithe. Otherwise pretty good inexpensive tablet.
customer_reviews.author: Always April

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend putting in a high quality 128gb micro SD and ...
customer_reviews.text: Wicked fast, even with multiple apps running. Highly recommend putting in a high quality 128gb micro SD and setting as permanent memory instead of portable (with the ez tutorial online, just search.( Great resolution and vivid colors! Compact, slim and with the case I got, rugged enough to toss in a sling bag and bang around. I'm still amazed at the current price point and this is the best bang for my buck I've gotten in a while!
customer_reviews.author: Pillow Dood

customer_reviews.title: Works with DJi mini drone controller for flying
customer_reviews.text: Wanted something reasonable priced to use for flying drone, Works fine with DJi mini drone
customer_reviews.author: Bruce Reynolds

customer_reviews.title: ASUS Tablet
customer_reviews.text: So far I've enjoyed this tablet very much. The price was right and I'm still learning on it. Mine holds a charge all day and I'm on it a lot. It's very clear and bright and very responsive. I like it!
customer_reviews.author: deborah shaffer

customer_reviews.title: It's a nice tablet. Wasn't sure what to expect after reading ...
customer_reviews.text: It's a nice tablet. Wasn't sure what to expect after reading some of the reviews. But I like to tablet a lot. It's an upgrade from my Samsung Tab4. I don't think the bloatware is as much of a problem as some of the other reviewers. Just my opinion. It's just the right size for me. I agree that the battery life could be better. Using the display settings you can improve battery life. I'm happy with the tablet and would buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: RockeyMaps

customer_reviews.title: Not so good and I got a bad one.
customer_reviews.text: It was ok. The screeen was not very clear and brightening it was not much help. Honestly, a cheap Samsung from Wal-Mart for a $100 would be better. It kept acting up, by going to sleep while in use. It happened to me about 20 times and also to my father and sister, so I returned it and got the Zenpad S. It's much better
customer_reviews.author: PJ II

customer_reviews.title: I love the tablet
customer_reviews.text: I love the tablet, however, I realized if I put the case on it that I purchased from amazon as well... and use the stand...if the 2 magnetic flaps from the case touch the back side of the tablet, it causes it to shut off. Now that I have discovered what I believe is causing my problem I haven't had an issue with it and I have tested my theory :)
customer_reviews.author: danielle

customer_reviews.title: I am so glad that I chose the zenpad
customer_reviews.text: I was unsure how this tablet would perform. I am so glad that I chose the zenpad. Asus is my favorite tablet brand so far. My last asus tablet was a memopad. I loved that one so much until I lost it. This one is 20 times better. I l also love that the zenpad has different size choices. It is also very fast at responding when being used. It plays videos beautifully. The screen is amazing, no matter what angle you have it at you can see it perfectly. Go Asus for making such a nice product.
customer_reviews.author: teresa

customer_reviews.title: Great quality and price
customer_reviews.text: I had an older 8" tablet from ASUS that was in need of replacement, so I bought one of these. The price was right, and the quality of the product is excellent. And, of course, the OS could be upgraded to Android 6.0 (Marshmallow). Hopefully Android 7 (Nougat) will eventually be offered.
customer_reviews.author: H. R. Holt

customer_reviews.title: Not bad, but if you're going to have a tablet ...
customer_reviews.text: Not bad, but if you're going to have a tablet for a couple of years, spending more is probably worth it.. Screen is OK, but nothing special - wishy-washy to my eye - colors meh, sharpness allright... Performance, like the screen OK. Have to say, the OS updated to latest version of Android (in a few installments) within a day. If not prompted, check for updates.
customer_reviews.author: onefussyone

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: Great tablet for the price. Nicely done ASUS! I bought a Lenovo yoga pad 8, but returned it because it was too slow. This tablet isn't super fast but plenty quick enough for just about any purpose. Considering this isn't really a high end device, I have no complaints.
customer_reviews.author: twofive0

customer_reviews.title: Very good unit. Beautiful display
customer_reviews.text: Very good unit. Beautiful display. It updated itself to Android 7.0 right away. I owned a Memo 7" and loved it. This is even better and the price is great. I like this a lot.
customer_reviews.author: John C

customer_reviews.title: No apps on sd card
customer_reviews.text: The fact that i can't put my apps on my sd card sucks, but that is Android's fault, not the tablet's. The tablet is great for the cost. Pic quality isnt good, but i used it for skype and i worked very well i must say. Very satisfied overall. Just wish Android would change their stupid system.
customer_reviews.author: S. Lennon

customer_reviews.title: Stopped Connecting
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for a couple of weeks then it stopped randomly disconnecting, or not connecting, to perfectly good wifi networks at home and work. Error is "Authentication Problems" but it's on networks that always used to work and still work for all the other devices on them. Can't find any explanation or fix online. I did two hard re-sets but the problem recurred almost immediately. Useless device if it won't connect to the internet.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: Slow to start
customer_reviews.text: It works well for my occasional needs but seems to take forever to turn on. Maybe I'm too impatient, but I have to hold the power button 10 to 15 seconds. Sometimes it takes a second tap. It then performs without issue.
customer_reviews.author: JudyR

customer_reviews.title: Battery issue
customer_reviews.text: The tablet turns itself off every time it goes down to 15% battery, and it did that right out of the box, brand new. But I didn’t use the tablet a lot when I first bought it and I naively thought I just had to do a few cycles of charge/discharge in order for the battery to be “fixed”. By the time I looked into returning it, it was too late. Oh well, it wasn’t that expensive. But I wouldn’t recommend. I have a samsung galaxy tab and in general is a better tablet in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: G Family

customer_reviews.title: Check if wifi connection sends it in a restarting loop when connected.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this about a month ago, decent tablet, only and probably biggest problem is that it's constantly restarts when the wifi is switched on and connected to a functioning network. Currently using it on a Bluetooth tethering mode for internet which is still somewhat limited to the apps and speed of data. Still looking if there is something to fix this issue because the tablet works pretty well with the games and functionality for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Lee Roxburgh

customer_reviews.title: nice tablet, good screen
customer_reviews.text: It has a good screen, however, poor battery life, slow, cheaply built, the back cover is flimsy, does not fit all that well and I had to finally remove it and use without it. It is just cheap.
customer_reviews.author: ABA, Ph.D.

customer_reviews.title: Not quite living up to the reviews
customer_reviews.text: I'm having some trouble with it. I think it is locking up intermittently. It has plenty of memory and is quick when it's working, but at times it doesn't recognize that I've touched the screen, so I have to wait till it's ready. It's annoying not knowing if I didn't touch the screen or if it's just having memory issues. :/
customer_reviews.author: Donna L. DeLeon

customer_reviews.title: This has been the worst experience. I would not buy this product
customer_reviews.text: This has been the worst experience. I would not buy this product. It comes with so many programs installed that there is virtually no storage. So I bought a SD card which doesn't seem to change the storage.... I was able to talk to customer service rep who said that apps can not be stored on the SD card which means this product is useless. I have very small needs with a tablet... three apps and the internet is what I need. However, this won't provide for those needs. Going to return this as soon as I can.
customer_reviews.author: Juliana Wissa

customer_reviews.title: Back light turns on when you open case, amazingly cool!
customer_reviews.text: I wound up buying two of these for Christmas presents after mine performed so well. Like a lot of people I'm upgrading from the Nexus 7, (gave Nexus to a friend, still works great) and I was a little hesitant at first getting something with half as much memory as my Nexus but honestly for my needs this thing is perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Koygo

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the money...why buy an Ipad
customer_reviews.text: Thought about buying an Ipad Mini but this high end Android Asus tablet is less $$$ and does everything and more!! Plus for a refurb its clean and functions great so far!!!
customer_reviews.author: F. R.

customer_reviews.title: Great Android tablet by ASUS
customer_reviews.text: Excellent android tablet. The price was a bargain. I am experienced with ASUS motherboards, and I was hoping for a similar quality experience. I have not been disappointed. Updated without an issue to android 7.0. Operates with no glitches.
customer_reviews.author: M Carl Bailey Jr

customer_reviews.title: So far works great
customer_reviews.text: Does what I needed in a tablet. Wish I could have found it in 7 inch but 8 inch is OK. No problems so far.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Two New Units Simply Didn't Work
customer_reviews.text: Maybe just bad luck, but I bought two of these and, right out of the box, both kept shutting off and restarting over and over. I tried factory reset but that didn't work. I "chatted" online with Asus customer service which ended with their recommending I send them back to them for work. Fortunately I was able to return them to Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: WILLIAM A SZERLIP

customer_reviews.title: Great Tablet Great Price
customer_reviews.text: Came on time shipping box was perfect.Great just what I needed I love Asus products they are wonderful.. Will buy again very happy customer! Thank you
customer_reviews.author: Painlynx

customer_reviews.title: As worse as a Fire tablet
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't have much internal memory. Can't play pokemon tcgo or have many apps on it without it going bananas or stupid slow. Tried installing a microSD card for more memory and that was a fail as well.
customer_reviews.author: maggs

product_meta.title: ASUS Z380M-A2-GR ZenPad 8 Dark Gray 8-inch Android Tablet [Z380M] 2MP Front / 5MP Rear PixelMaster Camera, WXGA TouchScreen, 16GB Onboard Storage, Quad-Core 1.3GHz Processor, 802.11a/b/g/n WiFi
product_meta.description: ASUS Zenpad Z380M-A2-GR Touch Screen 8" IPS WXGA (1280800) 189 PPI, MTK 8163 Quad-Core 1.3GHz, 2GB DDR3L, Mali-T720, 16GB EMMC, Android 6.0 (Marshmallow), 802.11abgn, 2MP Front & 5MP Rear, Bluetooth 4.0, Dark Grey
feature_bullets: Incredible 76.5% screen-to-body ratio gives you a vivid and rich HDTV Tablet experience.MediaTek MT8163 Quad-Core, 64bit
Fashion-inspired design carries modern influences for a luxurious, clean look for universal and stylish appeal
ASUS VisualMaster optimizes all aspects of display resulting in an incredibly realistic viewing expereince
ASUS ZenUI improves the Android experience to be simpler and smarter with more than 1,000 features. Wireless Data Network : WLAN802.11 a/b/g/n
Zenpad 8.0's PixelMaster Dual camera is designed to deliver stunning, high-resolution photos

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.9 out of 5 stars827 ratings3.9 out of 5 stars
